attributes(attributes) → {Cheerio}

Update each selected node with a set of attributes. If an attribute in the input is undefined, it will remove that attribute from the selected nodes.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
attributes Array.<string>

Attributes.
Source:
  • moov_cheerio.js, line 301
Returns:

Return updated cheerio.

Type
Cheerio
Example
<p>$('a').attributes({'data-ur-toggler-component': 'button', 'class': 'mw-button'})</p>

dumpTable() → {Cheerio}

Convert the selected table to a div structure. It will convert all table elements to divs and remove the table attributes.

Like:

table -> div.mw-was-table; thead -> div.mw-was-thead; tbody -> div.mw-was-tbody; tfoot -> div.mw-was-foot; tr -> div.mw-was-tr; td -> div.mw-was-td; th -> div.mw-was-th;

Source:
  • moov_cheerio.js, line 523
Returns:

Return updated cheerio

Type
Cheerio
Example
<p>let myTable = body.find('table');
myTable.dumpTable();</p>

removeIfEmpty(optionsopt) → {Cheerio}

Remove nodes in selection with no content inside of them. Trims the selection, then removes any nodes that have no hide param is for when we can't remove the element(s).

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
options Object <optional>

Options of removeIfEmpty.

Properties
Name Type Description
hide boolean

Hide an element instead of removing it.
Source:
  • moov_cheerio.js, line 389
Returns:

Return updated cheerio.

Type
Cheerio

trim() → {Cheerio}

Trim whitespace found within selection. Only looks one level deep for whitespace, nested text nodes are untouched.
